results.title: The Circle
results.creator_credit: Mort Ransen, John Kemeny and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Produced in 1967, this black and white film is an inmate’s view of Daytop, a drug treatment center on Staten Island, New York, where addicts learn to get along without drugs. Uncompromising, often brutal group therapy sessions are designed to shake loose the excuses a victim makes for himself. The people and situations shown are authentic; only one actor was employed. The results obtained at Daytop are regarded by some psychiatrists as a breakthrough. Cast: Don Francks.

results.title: The Christmas tree
results.brief_description: This is a traditional Ukrainian folktale, based on a story by Michaelo Kochubinsky, set in the 19th century. The story concerns eleven year old Ivanko, his parents, a mysterious old man and the “special” Christmas tree that tests the family’s faith and draws them together.

results.title: The Christmas dream
results.creator_credit: B Zeman, K Zeman and Czechoslovak Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A fantasy in which a little girl’s toys come to life in a dream - the toys being played by puppets. (The film is noteworthy for the excellence of the puppet animation in the original material - for American distribution introductory and concluding sequences have been added to the film by Castle Films, USA.). Music only - no language.

results.title: Detention
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
Four students are being kept in detention for one hour after school. They are bored and cannot wait to be allowed to leave. The clock ticks slowly on. Finally the clock strikes four and they are free to go.

results.title: The Chord sharp = Der Falschspieler = Le Faux joueur
results.creator_credit: Alastair McIlwain, Ian Moo Young, Joachim Kreck, Volker Kriegel and Hand Made Films
results.brief_description: A superbly animated non-narrated look at the making of a rock superstar. Details, in images that can be easily read by children, the way in which the hype process both creates a media personality and effectively dehumanizes that personality at the same time. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Crushed
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
A young man, in his disgust at watching a terrible film entitled “Fear”, makes the dramatic decision to run it over several times with his car.

results.title: The Champions. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Janet Leissner, Peter Katadotis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Rene Levesque and Pierre Elliott Trudeau, Canada’s chief political protagonists, are the focus of this two part documentary. Part one covers their early years up to 1967. Using rare photos, newsreel footage and interviews with close political colleagues, the film provides the background to the struggle between the two men and their ideologies. In doing so, it helps to illuminate a great crisis in Canadian history. Awards: Toronto

results.title: The Chinese connection = Fist of fury
results.creator_credit: Lo Wei, Raymond Chow and National General Pictures
results.brief_description: This martial arts action film stars Bruce Lee as Chen Chen, returning to his former school in early 20th Century Shanghai to learn that his beloved teacher has been murdered. While probing the man’s death and seeking vengeance, Chen discovers that a drug smuggling operation, a rival school, and simmering racial tensions between Chinese and Japanese locals are factors in the nefarious dealings at his school and in his master’s murder. Poorly dubbed into English. Cast includes: Bruce Lee, Robert Baker, Miao Ker Hsiu.

results.title: The Child in the middle
results.creator_credit: Gerard Schaefer, Merrill S. Brody and University of California, Los Angeles. Dept. of Theater Arts
results.brief_description: Underlines the importance of co-operation by parents and teachers in reaching understanding of children’s problems. In a dramatised example (based on an actual case), Martha causes concern to her teacher when she withdraws from school work and school contacts. The teacher discovers that Martha is throwing away the lunch cut by her grandmother, who also figures oddly in Martha’s free expression art work. Discussion with the parents and the headmistress clears the way for Martha’s readjustment to school life.

results.title: The Child and the saw
results.creator_credit: Daniel Landin, Richard Heslop and IKON (GB)
results.brief_description: The child sleeps. It is the morning of her birthday. She chooses her favourite shoes and her special dress. She is nine years old today. A parcel arrives. The saw has come. They played and they played and played. And then the inevitable happened.
